title: Works perfectly!
comment: Had to restart LibreOffice after changing the settings but after that it works perfectly. Does exactly what I need. Laser pointer doesn't work but I don't use it anyway.

title: Wonderfull apps
comment: I have to tried this apps. Its worked in ubuntu and windows. Thanks created this apps.

title: Too good
comment: Works seamlessly with Ubuntu 14.04 and mi4i

title: Works great
comment: Works like a charm!

title: Thanks, appreciate it
comment: This worked well for me on linux wifi. However one quibble about the UI.  I would like to see the timer displayed in detail at all times and remove the "NOTES" heading. I know they are my notes, you don't have to tell me and I want the screen space. I would also love functionality where I could set times starting a specific slide. (i.e. save a time to a slide such that when I get to it stops the previous timer and starts a new timer).

title: Superb
comment: Works great on windows. I tried to use the WiFi feature in Linux but failed. Bluetooth works fine.

title: works great for LAN connected devices too
comment: unlike some proprietary office suite it provides control over WLAN as well as bluetooth. Would like to see it extended for pdf presentations too.

title: It works!
comment: It works, but I get random crashes whenever I rotate my device (it's on auto-rotate).    And how does laser-pointer mode work? I can activate it, and it shows me a different screen but I don't see it working. No "laser" at all. Also tried to search for additional information on this issue, but I haven't found any.

title: WOOW!
comment: Simply Fabulous, I love it!

title: Excellent!
comment: Quick, smooth and easy - it's hard to fault.  It would be nice to have a built in pointer and a constantly visible preview slide, and it would help if the  pane view started from or at least included the current slide, but it's still an outstanding app.It's got a pointer now!

title: Excellent
comment: It works perfectly and has very nice features.

title: Perfect
comment: Super easy to setup and will give our pastors control over their slides and notes for seminars etc that they didn't before. Great app!

title: Sleek
comment: does exactly what it says. brilliant
Awesome

title: Great
comment: Does exactly what is needed of it, easy to use, and has really helped me out when it comes to making presentations (and made MS Office using friends slightly envious).

title: Perfect!
comment: This is exactly what I needed. It's such a pleasure to think "hey, I wish there was an app to do exactly what I need", and then find this one!

title: Easy…peasy setup
comment: Doesn't do a lot but what it does do,  it does flawlessly.
No functionality
All cool just needs better UI design
Awesome

The fix for the crash on start got fixed two days later. Maybe just a coincidence, but a very pleasant one. I did enjoy the app and found it extremely useful, with notes and the likes. Good job! Thanks a lot!

title: Does what it is supposed to
comment: Despite the occasional hiccough, this app is smooth and useful. I like being able to step or from behind the laptop when presenting.

title: Fantastic
comment: Serves as 10/10. Works superbly.

title: PowerPoints
comment: This apps very best!

comment: Very good as it is now, but it would be even better if the activation of the pointer was activated by a long press the mobile screen.

title: Perfect!

comment: Love the app. It's simple and smooth. I liked the fact that there is a pointer feature as well. What I would like to see is the ability to add annotations. 5 stars if that happens :-)

title: It works fine!
comment: On my Galaxy S2+ it works fine, but every time I want to start a presentation via bluetooth I have to start it twice in order to get a picture of the current slide on the phone. It would also be nice to just hide the notes section or make it smaller if there are no notes. Also making the timer more visible would be great! Nice app!

title: it works!
comment: It starts working after I followed the libreOffice side setups (restarted libreOffice as well).  I can change slide and view notes on the slides. Perfect.

title: Great app!
comment: Excellent work by developers!! Hatsoff!!
Excellent app!

title: OK, works now

Works

title: Tim Dyer
comment: Works very well with Nexus 7, also Samsung Note 2, and my laptop running a projector.   Great for a training environment.  World love the ability to see animations (such as dot points appearing 'on click') on the Nexus 7.

title: Great tool
comment: Would be handy if it it could override the screen lock on timeout so it wouldn't lock while presenting

title: It works!
comment: It does what it's supposed to do, without fuss, or messing around.  Beautiful!

title: Useful and well designed
comment: The earlier version was good... But the new 2.0 version is excellent!

title: Nexus 7 & MacBook - 2.0 does the trick
comment: Connecting through both bluetooth and wifi work well now, and the app works well for presentation control.  This is a good pickup for people who use LibreOffice and android for their presentations.
There are many changes in the 2.0.0 release. Check it out!

title: Making great progress!
comment: Making great progress. Only missing feature is to show both current and next slide on mobile. Had to enable advanced features on my Arch Linux machine for the this to work over WiFi. Will I be able to turn that off in LO 4.2?
There are many changes in the 2.0.0 release. Check it out!

title: Amazing
comment: Libreoffice rocks

title: Excellent
comment: Best help ful app for remote presentation

title: Great app!
comment: Would be super great if I could flip slides with volume rocker while phone is locked (screen off) - like switching songs in music players

title: Simple app which does exactly what it should do.
Super-easy to use
comment: Using Bluetooth, this app "just works". Using WiFi, after following the instructions in the How-To page, again it "just works". The action is fast and smooth. I like the way the phone shows the page and the notes, allowing you to get away from having to have a printed version. The grid view lets you quickly skip to another slide. A good, albeit very simple, application.

title: Works well
comment: Needs option to remove manually added wifi computers.

title: Great and Promising
comment: In less than a year there was 6 bugfix releases of this app, so it's became a lot more stable than it's inicial (and previous) version. It's easy to use, and extremely helpful during presentations, and now also really reliable.  Let's hope that the full LibreOffice can also come here soon enough.

title: This app is wonderful... when it works at all
comment: This is probably the best way to give a presentation I've ever used. The notes, slide navigation, and timer features are exactly what you'd want.  Unfortunately, it's basically impossible to get it to connect. Out of fifty attempts, I've managed to get it to work perhaps six times, ever.   I'd almost rather it didn't exist at all, instead of taunting me.
There are many changes in the 2.0.0 release. Check it out!

title: Good but needs work
comment: It doesn't deactivate screensaver during presentation. It also doesn't let you engage interactive slides like videos like a mouse can.  On the right track though :)

title: Not working on OSX Lion
comment: It's not working either on the wifi or bluetooth. Also the newest osx version doesn't have options to enable.
There are many changes in the 2.0.0 release. Check it out!

title: Nice
comment: :)) Works great :D
awesome

title: Works well
comment: Works as advertised but initial connection via bluetooth can be sketchy. Nice having the slide notes on my phone. Overall great app.

title: Grated app....
comment: But want full libre office.....

title: Genial
comment: Excelente aplicación,  funciona a la maravilla.
Best remote for the best office suite

title: Great but sometimes hard to connect
comment: So one less star

title: Great...
comment: ... once it runs, however there are some annoyances. First of all, it is not clear Bluetooth is used as the main screen only shows an 'Add wi-fi computer manually'.  When it runs, it sometimes does not react correctly to 'Start presentation'. LibreOffice on the notebook already shows the presentation, but the phone or tablet does not respond.  When landscape view is used, flipping through the slides in your deck is way too sensitive. including some simple back and forth buttons might also help, but first of all, tweak it down a little.  In the slides overview, especially on a smaller screen, a highlighted border is shown on the line below the slide you tapped (and is shown).  Besides this, it is a nice tool that I will certainly use more often. Thanks, keep it up guys! The only thing I could wish for now is a stable version of LibreOffice for Android ;-)

title: Really does what it says.
comment: And i thought it was hard to operate. But then again you have to activate something on your libreoffice to get it going. Now i present at class and will look cool :p

title: Completely awesome!
comment: We can even control the slides through Wi-Fi (if the PC is on the same network obviously) instead of using a Bluetooth dongle. For this to achieve, you need to activate LibreOffice experimental features in the options.  What I really appreciate too are the slide notes availability and the slides preview.
Bad soft
There are many changes in the 2.0.0 release. Check it out!
Amazing

title: Good app
comment: Do exactly is supposed and probably the best remote control for presentations I have found. Only the swipe-to-next-slide is too much sensitive and there should be possibility to change it.

title: Wonderful App
comment: Does exactly what it says. Working wonderfully with my Xolo q800 and LibreOffice 4.0.2.2.

title: Does exactly what is says on the tin
comment: Once the experimental features option is enabled (along with the Enable Remote Control option) works flawlessly.  Could probably do with making it clearer on Google Play that it requires LibreOffice 4.

title: Just Brilliant
comment: Works flawlessly with my Debian/Ubuntu systems. Great to see this functionality built in to Libreoffice

title: Buggy but works
comment: A bit buggy but works. Had some problems with presentation not starting and fc's but overall, it worked. Hard to do bt connect.

title: Great app!!
comment: App works as promised connecting my Samsung S2 and my Ubuntu-based PC. Favourite feature (in addition to 'everything') is the inclusion of the 'speaker notes' on my phone below the slide control. One change request: When using the one-slide-at-a-time mode, where you swipe left or right to move forward or back through slides, would be great if the sensitivity was adjusted - it can be overly sensitive at times meaning I have to very carefully pay attention to how I'm moving ahead one slide or risk skimming across several slides all at once. Of course, I have since learned to use the volume up/down for more precise control, but a more precise screen-swipe option would be ideal. The volume up/down can also be used to simulate a 'mouse-click' for appear-on-mouse-click animated elements. THANK YOU!

title: Does not connect
comment: Does not cnnect to libreoffice 4.0.2 on macos 10.7.4.
There are many changes in the 2.0.0 release. Check it out!

title: good app
comment: does what it says, has a very friendly interface. However, it allows only changing slides, so if slides includes animated insertion of texts, this app does not work properly. Am expecting a next button or similar so that the animated entry of texts can be controlled. :)
Highly useful

title: Wifi needs another check box
comment: after fighting with the wifi option for the last few weeks and almost giving up on this app (because I don't have bluetooth), I noticed at the bottom of the wiki, one of the bugs is that wifi needs "experimental features" enabled under tools/options. I encourage you to do this if you are doing wifi. It actually is a flawless app once it works, but very young in it's development. Super smooth sliding, good feedback of current slide and all that. Could use bigger icons in the slide sorter view on the remote, or better yet, a forward/back buttons/arrows. the ability to jump is great, but i don't want (in my adrenaline mode of presenting) to over shoot my next slide, so an arrow for advance once would be good as well.

title: Awesome
comment: Works very well. A great alternative to presentation console.

title: Great app
comment: This is very usefull for presentation...! Hope the libreoffice 100% compatible to MSO.

title: Great!
comment: It took me some time to figure out how to make it work, but it was because I didn't RTFM. Now it is working perfectly. I only restate 2 suggestions: time counter and button feedback would be nice.

title: Perfect work
comment: No trouble at all, but then again I only need it for simple presentations.

title: It works
comment: This is a great app. It would be even better if it had remote mouse/pointer functionality so that a smartphone could replace a laser pointer too.

title: wow
comment: Excelente app. Funciona perfectamente el modo WiFi en Archlinux.Muy útil

title: Wonderful
comment: At least an amazing remote for Android + Linux, the only one able to run over bluetooth. Running perfectly with my Archlinux box. It would be nice to have a time counter in the phone, like the one in presenter console.  Keep the good work!

title: No WiFi
comment: I'm very supportive of the idea, but still can't connect via WiFi. Also, the wiki instructions don't show how to connect via WiFi.
There are many changes in the 2.0.0 release. Check it out!

title: Awesome! Samsung Galaxy S3 mini
comment: Works great. Tested with Xubuntu 12.10, both Bluetooth and Wifi. At least Libreoffice 4.0.1 needed.

title: Works even over WiFi
comment: There's some problem with this app, for example the menu hardware button doesn't work. In the list of computers, computers aren't buttons so we don't have any feedback when we click on it. Bluetooth is turned on even if we want to use WiFi connection. There's no time counter started with the presentation We can't change time behaviour (i'm fench i want to see 16h30 not 4h30 PM) There's no on-screen button that have the same effects as volume buttons, if I didn't read nothing about this app before i won't know that i have to use volume buttons.  Etc...
There are many changes in the 2.0.0 release. Check it out!

title: Galaxy Nexus 4.2.2 / Mac OS 10.6.8
comment: Couldn't get Bluetooth communication to work. I almost gave up completely, but decided to give the WiFi connection a shot. At first it didn't work either, but then I heard that you have to enable experimental features in LibreOffice for the WiFi mode to be enabled. As soon as I enabled the experimental features, I was able to connect via WiFi instantly.   Four stars because it worked beautifully once I got it connected, but only four stars because Bluetooth didn't work.  I can't wait to see how this matures.

title: Xperia SL
comment: Works great... Very good app useful for better presentation....... With good options like blank screen... Grid view of slides etc.....

title: Good Tool
comment: It's working fine on my Sony Xperia Active S17i device.  But, I think this tool can improve more functions to control the presention, for example show notes etc.

title: Almost great
comment: Works fine on both my HTC Desire Z and my Nexus 7, but foreign characters show up wrongly in the Notes section -- for example, instead of the Spanish word "desempeño" you get to see "desempeÃ±o". It seems like UTF-8 characters were shown as Latin 1 (ISO 8859) instead.

title: Impressive App
comment: Very Very Impressive App. I liked it very much & it can literally replace Presenters. Why should one pay 5000 Rs for presenter when you can even read notes in mobile whilst presenting??   Still many features need to be added. Some important I expect are 1. Exit or End Slide Show 2. Slide Sorting 3. Hide Slides 4. Lock Screen rotations in mobile ( Global setting over ride ) ( While in presentation orientation of mobile changes every now and then. So the screen. )  Any way Thanks to the developers.

title: Great and useful now
comment: This is really great, gives me freedom in my talks and love the use of the volume key.  Features and bugs that prevent me giving it a 5*: 1. UTF-8 chars are unencoded on my Gallaxy 2 phone 2. I can't see the next slide easily, it help me know what I shouldn't be talking about just yet.  But even with those issues, this is really cool.

title: Very useful!
comment: This makes redundant the remotes that you normally see used. I can now control my slides from my phone, and jump to specific slides on whim. Excellent for presentations!

title: Great app
comment: Works on my Galaxy CH@t and Nexus 7. I hope there would be a better support for tablet devices soon.

title: Working great!
comment: It's now working like a charm. Time to impress my friends with this! *runs away after making horrible pun*

title: Nice
comment: Works like a charm

title: Some enhancements to be appreciated.
comment: - please add wakelocks to keep the screen on (low contrast is fine but entering pincodes while presenting is annoying. - my phone screen is too small to read notes, but I do want the option to see the next slide(s) without switching over to it

title: A promising first step
comment: Connects my Nexus 4 perfectly via Bluetooth with the presentation notebook running Linux.   There is still lots of room for enhancements (preview zoom, time display, vibration timer, …), but this first version is a great start.

title: when will there be libre office for android?
comment: hevnt tried yet because havnt had time to install  the linux os, so 3 stars first. but i want to request, i think this same for the other libre users, will you guys from document foundation please port the libre into android as soon as possible. mostly i have problem viewing the libre document by the application available in play store. hopefully there will be a libre office for android so we can view, edit and make document directly from the android. thanx

title: Unable to connect to my Ubuntu PC
comment: Hi, I am having problem in connecting to my Laptop using bluetooth. hope I connect soon and the application is useful.
There are many changes in the 2.0.0 release. Check it out!

title: Works on Android 4.2.2, not 4.0.3
comment: Nexus 7 works, not Samsung Galaxy S II. Nice app but a WIP. Look forward to new features soon.

title: Good
comment: Perfect on ubuntu

title: Works fine over bluetooth
comment: I had an older version installed till now, built from source. This one is much better, volume up/down is enabled by default to switch slides.  To use wireless mode, one has to enable 'experimental mode' in LibreOffice. But for conferences with over-crowded wifi, bluetooth is just better.

title: Good
comment: What I want!

title: Cool but needs a lot of features
comment: I'm amazed of the idea of having an official impress remote application, well done. The application itself is basic, but I love the Volume Keys for navigation thing.  It would be better to have the following features included: - The ability to launch impress from the mobile application, as it should be already launched on the machine the mobile is paired to, to get the mobile application running. - The ability to choose a presentation to run from the recent opened files list on impress through the mobile phone application. - A timer that starts with launching the presentation to let the presenter know how long the whole thing has taken since he started. - A big "Next Slide" button on the application screen just in case people would like to use the touch screen as the touch flipping thing is really fast.  Overall, I love the application, well done. :)
Currently testing

title: So exited
comment: I helped design this XD

title: Nice combination
comment: I'm using linung for a long time, and this is a perfect combination with LO 4.0, especially impress.

title: Minimum Requirement LibreOffice 4+
comment: Ubuntu 13.04 by default may come with LibreOffice 4+ which is minimum requirement to use this app

title: Nice work
comment: Requires distro. supplied Linux packages or self built to work. Also need to enable Bluetooth before start .... then works well for me.

title: Very good
comment: Please review this app not bad. Their Website says that it currently only works on linux!!!

title: Couldn't connect
comment: it's a great idea, but I couldn't figure out how to get to connect even though they were both on the wifi network and I have the impress remote window open in my presentation. I even tried typing the IP address of my computer directly and it still didn't show up. I also tried pairing my bluetooth but that also didn't work. running Ubuntu 12.10, and quite technically savvy, it's too new to find any useful information on the internet for people that have gotten into work it seems. :(
There are many changes in the 2.0.0 release. Check it out!
